item.title: Fly-tipping next to Charlton train station, 4th January
item.description:
Hi there, This fly-tipping spot meant to be monitored daily, however, I don't think this was the case in the recent weeks. Please ensure it's cleaned this week and monitor daily Best

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Usual Fly-tipping area on Woolwich Road, 4th January
item.description:
Hi there, Please remove the current fly tipping from that spot and ensure regular monitoring of the area. Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Woolwich Road hasn't been swept over a month - urgent, 4th January
item.description:
Hi there, I've reported the state of Woolwich Road to the council throughout December and nothing was done due to low staff availability but also pretty bad prioritising of the street cleaning. Please ensure this is sorted asap as the road looks pretty much disgusting atm. I don't remember it looking so bad. Thanks, L

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle path - where painted blue -, 4th January
item.description:
There are 2 blue painted areas on the cycle path - the one at the location I have provided and one before this, further down the hill. Both of these blue patches are very icy. I was cycling here on Friday morning 2nd January 2025 - it was about 1 degree, the tarsealed paths were fine - but as soon as I hit the blue patch my bike just came out from under me. I looked at the paths and the blue areas only are very very slippery. I have been cycling for years and this is not really how a cycle path should be.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147, Haverstock Hill, Belsize Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rainton Road requires cleaning, 4th January
item.description:
Hi there, Rainton Road as well as neighbouring roads are full of rubbish everywhere. Please ensure sweeping is done this coming week. Best, L

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rathmore Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very dangerous icy road on a bend, 4th January
item.description:
The section of road surface between 46 and 52 Great Thrift has compacted sheet ice. This needs gritting as soon as possible. It is very dangerous for pedestrians to cross the road as well as for drivers to negotiate this sharp uphill bend in the road. With icy conditions and below freezing temperatures this ice looks set to remain. Please can this be urgently addressed and gritted. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Great Thrift, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal publicity on pavement from light on post, 4th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 354a, Camberwell New Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Slippery leaves, 4th January
item.description:
Main road SIDCUP from the crescent along to row of shops the pathways are covered in old wet slippery leaves. These have not been cleared I. Months and are now trodden down and have covered all the pathways. They are slippery and dangerous. Obviously now they are covered in ice which is even more dangerous forcing people to road walk Can they be cleared please
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, Longlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All the dog bins at over flowing, 4th January
item.description:
Every bin is full of dog poo bags. They are full up and dog bags are now lying all over the floor . Looks awful and ca. easily be damaged by foxes exposing dog excrement which is dangwrous and smelly. Also the area needs gritting as is very dangerous to walk on.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hemmings Close, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
